title: How to Make a Mega Chocolate Bar

methods.name: Melt and Build Mega Chocolate Bar

steps.headline: Buy five chocolate bars of choice.
steps.description: Line a baking or cookie sheet with wax paper or parchment paper, for a non-stick surface to work on.

steps.headline: Melt the first chocolate bar.
steps.description: Either melt in a microwave inside a microwave-safe container or melt over a double boiler.

steps.headline: Get the second chocolate bar and place it on the lined cookie sheet.
steps.description: Spread the slightly cooled melted chocolate from the first bar over the still intact second chocolate bar. Use a butter knife or a spatula to spread the melted chocolate.

steps.headline: Press down a third intact chocolate bar over the still moist spread-on chocolate.
steps.description: Place it directly in the same position as the second bar below it. Allow to dry in place or place in the refrigerator to set for 10 minutes or so.

steps.headline: Melt the fourth and fifth chocolate bars.
steps.description: These will be used as coating.

steps.headline: Use the melted last two chocolate bars to coat the stacked bars.
steps.description: Spread on enough melted chocolate to cover the bar in its entirety.

steps.headline: Allow to set in a cool place.
steps.description: When set, check for any gaps and if there are any, add more melted chocolate to cover.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The mega chocolate bar is now ready to enjoy. You can make the mega bar higher if wished, by stacking more bars on top. It's a good idea to try this one first though, to decide if you can handle more!

methods.name: Ice Cube Tray Mega Chocolate Bar

steps.headline: Chop the marshmallows into small pieces.
steps.description: Chop the fruit and nuts as well, if not already done. If you prefer other fillings, that's fine, you can experiment with fresh fruit, soft candies, fondant, etc.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate.
steps.description: Either melt in a microwave inside a microwave-safe container or melt over a double boiler. The chocolate should appear smooth when melted properly.

steps.headline: Add chocolate to the silicone ice cube tray.
steps.description: Use a silicone pastry brush to coat the ice cube holes with the melted chocolate. Be generous with the coating, make it thick. Also take it up the sides of the holes and over the edges to the surface surrounding each hole. The ice cube tray must be completely dry before doing this.

steps.headline: Transfer the ice cube tray to the refrigerator.
steps.description: Leave there for 10 minutes or so, allowing the spread chocolate to set firmly.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Fill each hole with the chopped marshmallows and chopped dried fruit and/or nuts.

steps.headline: Reheat the remaining melted chocolate so that is melted again.
steps.description: Allow to cool slightly, then pour over the holes, coating everything and filling up all gaps.

steps.headline: Ensure that the top of the chocolate is even and smooth.
steps.description: Tap the ice cube tray several times to cause the air bubbles to rise to the surface. You'll see them appear. This keeps them on the surface rather than within the chocolate, ensuring that you get solid chocolate.

steps.headline: Put back into the refrigerator to set.
steps.description: Or, you can leave it in a cool area.

steps.headline: Unmold when the chocolate has set.
steps.description: Peel back the silicone ice cube tray with care, revealing the mega chocolate bar beneath. You can choose to cut it to a smaller length or leave it as it is, depending on your preferences. The chocolate bar will probably need tidying around the edges to remove stray chocolate pieces. Too bad, you'll have to eat those bits, to dispose of the messy evidence.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The mega chocolate bar is now ready for serving or wrapping as a gift. Store in a cool, dark place. If you have used real fruit or real cream inside it, it must be kept in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Try one or more of the following chocolate bar recipes (some may need to be super sized):
steps.description: Giant Kit Kat bar Homemade Kit Kat bars Homemade Twix candy bar  Homemade Bounty bars.

steps.headline: Finished.

Allow to dry in place or place in the refrigerator to set for 10 minutes or so. Melt the fourth and fifth chocolate bars. These will be used as coating.
